intro: Enneapogon glaber, commonly known as the smooth false grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Enneapogon glaber is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
